claim: The student club expenses with average spending greater than $50 are: Bakery - Donuts, muffins; Club shirts; Pizza; Post Cards, Posters; Posters; Water, chips, cookies; and Water, cookies, chips.
extra_info: expense refers to expense_description; spend more than fifty dollars on average refers to DIVIDE( SUM(cost), COUNT(expense_id) ) > 50
reasoning: The query grouping expenses by expense_description and filtering where SUM(cost)/COUNT(expense_id) > 50 returns exactly the 7 items listed in the claim: Bakery - Donuts, muffins; Club shirts; Pizza; Post Cards, Posters; Posters; Water, chips, cookies; and Water, cookies, chips. The claim matches the database perfectly.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by examining the database schema and querying for expense descriptions with average spending greater than $50.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

tool_use_result.stdout:
attendance  event       income      member    
budget      expense     major       zip_code

input.description: Get schema for budget and expense tables

content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "budget"
(
    budget_id     TEXT
            primary key,
    category      TEXT,
    spent         REAL,
    remaining     REAL,
    amount        INTEGER,
    event_status  TEXT,
    link_to_event TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_event) references event(event_id)
);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "expense"
(
    expense_id          TEXT
            primary key,
    expense_description TEXT,
    expense_date        TEXT,
    cost                REAL,
    approved            TEXT,
    link_to_member      TEXT,
    link_to_budget      TEXT,
    foreign key (link_to_budget) references budget(budget_id),
    foreign key (link_to_member) references member(member_id)
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/student_club.sqlite" "SELECT expense_description, SUM(cost) as total_cost, COUNT(expense_id) as cnt, SUM(cost)/COUNT(expense_id) as avg_cost FROM expense GROUP BY expense_description HAVING SUM(cost)/COUNT(expense_id) > 50 ORDER BY expense_description;"
input.description: Find expense descriptions with average spending > $50

2. Club shirts ✓
3. Pizza ✓

5. Posters ✓
